poem:
Title: The Ritual of Motion

A cross-legged ode to health,
Man, bound by self-imposed stealth.
Leg over leg in humble sway,
Stealing minutes from the day.
To rise, sans hands, a task unbowed,
No heaven's aid here allowed.
In genuflection on this floor,
Where kneecap meets its hardwood moor,
Echoes old, in quietude kneel,
A sonnet spun in life's spinning wheel.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Touch your toes! Six fast, easy ways to improve your mobility – and live a longer life Remember the mobility challenge that went viral last year? It goes like this. You’re standing up; you can’t use your hands, so start by crossing your arms across your body. Cross one leg in front of the other. Drop down to sit cross-legged on the floor. From here, get on your knees with your toes behind you. Now". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
